14 def exit_gracefully(signum, frame):
15  """
16  This function enables a Ctrl+C interruption during running.
17  :param signum: pass
18  :param frame: pass
19  :return: none
20  """
21  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, original_sigint)
22  sys.exit(1)
23  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
24 
25 def float_to_uint(x_float, x_min, x_max, bits):
26  """
27  This function maps float data from the range of [x_min,x_max] to [0,bits]
28  for CAN communication.
29  :param x_float: float data needs to be mapped.
30  :param x_min: min value for float value
31  :param x_max: max value for float value
32  :param bits: max value for uint value
33  :return: mapped uint value
34  """
35  span = x_max-x_min
36  # Set software limits for the demanded variables
37  if x_float<x_min:
38  x_float = x_min
39  if x_float>x_max:
40  x_float = x_max
41  # !!! The documentation uses bits+1, but I do not get why
42  return int((x_float-x_min)*bits/span)
43 
44 
45 def uint_to_float(x_int, x_min, x_max, bits):
46  """
47  This function maps uint data from [0,bits] to [x_min,x_max].
48  :param x_int: uint data needs to be mapped
49  :param x_min: min value for float value
50  :param x_max: max value for float value
51  :param bits: max value for uint value
52  :return: mapped float value
53  """
54  span = x_max-x_min
55  return float((span/bits)*x_int+x_min)

59 import rospy
60 from can_msgs.msg import Frame
61 import math

64 class motor_testbench:
65  """
66  This class is the low-level control of the AK-series motors.
67  """
68  def __init__(self):
69  """
70  This init value sets up ros subscriber and publisher. It also sets basic motor parameters
71  and limits on pos,vel,tau,kp,kd.
72  """
73  # Setting up the main node
74  rospy.init_node('motor_testbench')
75  # Read the motorID from the node name
76  nodename = rospy.get_name()
77  self.motorID = int(nodename.split('_')[1])
78  self.motor_active = False
79  # Define a variable to hold if the motor position been set to zero changed
80  # Because two consecutive commands to set and unset from zero doesnt work
81  self.motor_pos_reset = False
82  # Log connection info
83  rospy.loginfo('motor testbench initialised')
84 
85  # A topic that where we can write the control commands
86  rospy.Subscriber('motor_state/'+str(self.motorID)+'/', tmotor_cmd, self.motor_state_callback)
87  rospy.Subscriber('motor_command/'+str(self.motorID)+'/', tmotor_cmd, self.motor_command_callback)
88  rospy.loginfo('motor state subscriber established')
89  rospy.loginfo('motor command subscriber established')
90 
91  # Parsed CAN messages republished here as data
92  self.can_response = rospy.Publisher('can_response/motor_'+str(self.motorID), tmotor_data, queue_size=10)
93  # # Initiate publishers to the CAN
94  self.can_command = rospy.Publisher('sent_messages', Frame, queue_size = 10)
95  # Using socketcan to read frames received from CAN
96  rospy.Subscriber('received_messages', Frame, self.can_msgrecv)
97 
98  # Now disarm the motor by default whenever the motor is switched on
99  self.disarmMotor()
100  rospy.loginfo('Initialising motor in disarmed state')
101 
102  # Fixed for all the motors
103  self.max_pos_bits = 0xFFFF # 16 bits for pos
104  self.max_tau_bits = 0xFFF # 12 bits for current
105  self.max_vel_bits = 0xFFF # 12 bits for vel
106 
107  # For control params
108  self.min_kp = 0
109  self.max_kp = 500
110  self.max_kp_bits = 0xFFF
111 
112  self.min_kd = 0
113  self.max_kd = 5
114  self.max_kd_bits = 0xFFF
115 
116  self.max_pos = 12.5 # rad
117  self.min_pos = -12.5 # rad
118 
119  # Add versions too
120  motors_list = ['AK60-6', 'AK70-10', 'AK80-9']
121  # motor_selected = 'AK80-9'
122  motor_selected = 'AK60-6'
123 
124  # AK-60-6
125  if motor_selected == motors_list[0]:
126  # Setup limits here
127  self.gear_ratio = 6
128 
129  # velocity
130  self.min_vel = -45.0 # rad/s
131  self.max_vel = 45.0 # rad/s
132 
133  # torque
134  self.min_tau = -15.0
135  self.max_tau = 15.0
136 
137  self.Kt = 0.068 # Nm/A
138 
139  # AK-70-10
140  if motor_selected == motors_list[1]:
141  # Setup limits here
142  self.gear_ratio = 10
143 
144  # velocity
145  self.min_vel = -50.0 # rad/s
146  self.max_vel = 50.0 # rad/s
147 
148  # torque
149  self.min_tau = -25.0
150  self.max_tau = 25.0
151 
152  self.Kt = 0.091 # Nm/A
153 
154  # AK-80-9
155  if motor_selected == motors_list[2]:
156  # Setup limits here
157  self.gear_ratio = 9
158 
159  # velocity
160  self.min_vel = -50.0 # rad/s
161  self.max_vel = 50.0 # rad/s
162 
163  # torque
164  self.min_tau = -18.0
165  self.max_tau = 18.0
166 
167  self.Kt = 0.091 # Nm/A
168  #=================================
169  rospy.spin()
170  #==================================
171 
172  def motor_state_callback(self, data):
173  """
174  This function is the callback function upon receiving "motor_state" data.
175  motor_state only change the states.(enable, setZero)
176  :param data: incoming motor_state command
177  :return: none
178  """
179  msg = Frame()
180  msg.id = self.motorID
181  msg.is_rtr = False
182  msg.is_extended = False
183  msg.is_error = False
184  msg.dlc = 8
185 
186  # set up a signal to let me know that motor_state data is received
187  rospy.loginfo('received motor_state data')
188 
189  # Use status to arm or disarm the motors
190  if data.status == True:
191  if data.setzero == False:
192  # # Check if the motor is already active
193  # if not self.motor_active:
194  # If the motor is inactive --> activate it
195  msg.data = [0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFC]
196  # Set motor to be active
197  self.motor_active = True
198  self.can_command.publish(msg)
199 
200  # If data.status is 0, then disarm,
201  if data.status == False:
202  if data.setzero == False:
203  # # Check if the motor is already deactivated
204  # if self.motor_active:
205  # Deactivate it if not deactivated already
206  msg.data = [0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFD]
207  # Set motor to be deactive
208  self.motor_active = False
209  self.can_command.publish(msg)
210 
211  # Check if the position is reset
212  # This can only be done when the status is active as per documents
213  # cannot set to zero without arming, i.e., only checks if the motor is armed
214  if data.setzero == True:
215  if data.status == True:
216  msg.data = [0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFE]
217  self.can_command.publish(msg)
218 
219  # Motor state callback is now differentiated from motor data callback
220  # This way, the state variables can be safely ignored when commands are passed
221  def motor_command_callback(self, data):
222  """
223  This function is the callback function of the "motor_command" data.
224  motor_command does not affect the states.(enable, setZero)
225  :param data: incoming motor_command data
226  :return:none
227  """
228  cmd = Frame()
229  cmd.id = self.motorID
230  cmd.is_rtr = False
231  cmd.is_extended = False
232  cmd.is_error = False
233  cmd.dlc = 8
234  rospy.loginfo('received motor_command data')
235  # Parse the requested motor command and send it as a CAN frame
236  # Check if the motor is armed
237  # THIS NEEDS TO BE TAKEN CARE!!! ONLY WORK IN DEGREES BUT SEND IN RADIANS
238  p_des = math.radians(data.position)
239  v_des = math.radians(data.velocity)
240  # rospy.loginfo(v_des)
241  tau_des = data.torque
242  kp_val = data.kp
243  kd_val = data.kd
244  if not self.motor_active:
245  raise Exception('The motor is not armed, please click "Enable" first')
246  else:
247  # We just need to do the reverse scaling done when the data was obtained
248  # Enable software limits again here
249  p_des = max(min(p_des, self.max_pos), self.min_pos)
250  # pos_bits = int((p_des-self.min_pos)*self.max_pos_bits/(self.max_pos-self.min_pos))
251  pos_bits = float_to_uint(p_des, self.min_pos, self.max_pos, self.max_pos_bits)
252  data0 = pos_bits >> 8
253  data1 = pos_bits & 0xFF
254  # velocity float --> bits
255  v_des = max(min(v_des, self.max_vel), self.min_vel)
256  # vel_bits = int((v_des-self.min_vel)*self.max_vel_bits/(self.max_vel-self.min_vel))
257  vel_bits = float_to_uint(v_des, self.min_vel, self.max_vel, self.max_vel_bits)
258  data2 = vel_bits >> 4
259  kp_val = max(min(kp_val, self.max_kp), self.min_kp)
260  # kp_bits = int((kp_val-self.min_kp)*self.max_kp_bits/(self.max_kp-self.min_kp))
261  kp_bits = float_to_uint(kp_val, self.min_kp, self.max_kp, self.max_kp_bits)
262  data3 = ((vel_bits & 0xF)<<4)|(kp_bits>>8)
263  data4 = int(kp_bits & 0xFF)
264  kd_val = max(min(kd_val, self.max_kd), self.min_kd)
265  # kd_bits = int((kd_val-self.min_kd)*self.max_kd_bits/(self.max_kd-self.min_kd))
266  kd_bits = float_to_uint(kd_val, self.min_kd, self.max_kd, self.max_kd_bits)
267  data5 = kd_bits >> 4
268  # !!! This is actually the information about the current
269  tau_des = max(min(tau_des, self.max_tau), self.min_tau)
270  # tau_bits = int((tau_des-self.min_tau)*self.max_tau_bits/(self.max_tau-self.min_tau))
271  tau_bits = float_to_uint(tau_des, self.min_tau, self.max_tau, self.max_tau_bits)
272  data6 = ((kd_bits & 0xF)<<4)| (tau_bits >> 8)
273  data7 = tau_bits & 0xFF
274  cmd.data = [data0, data1, data2, data3, data4, data5, data6, data7]
275  # Publish the data to CAN
276  self.can_command.publish(cmd)
277 
278  def can_msgrecv(self, data):
279  """
280  This function parses the incoming CAN msg into position,velocity and tau information.
281  Then it publishes the (pos,vel,tau) information through can_response channel.
282  This function is used as current state monitoring.
283  :param data: incoming uint16 CAN msg
284  :return: msg through can_response channel
285  """
286  # rospy.loginfo('in can msg recv')
287  info = data.data
288  # Check if the message recieved is for the corresponding motorID
289  if info[0] == self.motorID:
290  msg = tmotor_data()
291  # Now we need to parse the data from the motor to interpretable data
292  # the first (info[0]) is reserved for the motorID (1)
293  # 1nd and 2rd are upper and lower bits of pos
294  pos_bits = float(info[1]<<8|info[2])
295  # from bits to rad
296  # pos_rad = ((self.max_pos-self.min_pos)/(self.max_pos_bits))*pos_bits+self.min_pos
297  pos_rad = uint_to_float(pos_bits, self.min_pos, self.max_pos, self.max_pos_bits)
298  # publish position in degree for readability
299  msg.position = math.degrees(pos_rad)
300 
301  # 3 and 4 data contain 8 bits and 4 bits resp.
302  vel_bits = float(info[3]<<4|info[4]>>4)
303  # vel_rads = ((self.max_vel-self.min_vel)/(self.max_vel_bits))*vel_bits+self.min_vel
304  vel_rads = uint_to_float(vel_bits, self.min_vel, self.max_vel, self.max_vel_bits)
305  msg.velocity = vel_rads
306 
307  # 4 and 5 have 4 and 8 bits respectively
308  # Toruque cannot be observed by passive movement though?
309  # !!! Need to check it in running
310  tau_bits = float((info[4] & 0x0F)<<8|info[5])
311  # tau_nm = (((self.max_tau-self.min_tau)/(self.max_tau_bits))*tau_bits+self.min_tau)*self.Kt
312  # tau_nm = uint_to_float(tau_bits, self.min_tau, self.max_tau, self.max_tau_bits)*self.Kt*self.gear_ratio
313  tau_nm = uint_to_float(tau_bits, self.min_tau, self.max_tau, self.max_tau_bits)
314  msg.torque = tau_nm
315 
316  self.can_response.publish(msg)
317  pass
318 
319  # We need to constantly publish something to get the info from the motor
320  # def ping_motor(self, data=[0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00]):
321  def ping_motor(self):
322  """
323  This function is a test to send data through can_command channel.
324  :return:
325  """
326  msg = Frame()
327  msg.id = self.motorID
328  # Since this frame is just to request the data
329  # we set the rtr bit to True --> Just a remote frame
330  msg.is_rtr = True
331  msg.is_extended = False
332  msg.is_error = False
333  msg.dlc = 0
334  self.can_command.publish(msg)
335 
336  def disarmMotor(self):
337  """
338  This function disarms the motor.
339  :return:none
340  """
341  msg = Frame()
342  msg.id = self.motorID
343  msg.is_rtr = False
344  msg.is_extended = False
345  msg.is_error = False
346  msg.dlc = 8
347  msg.data = [0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFF,0xFD]
348  self.can_command.publish(msg)
349  # Set the status of active
350  self.motor_active = False
351 
352  # # listener
353  # def listener(self):
354 
355 
356 if __name__ == '__main__':
357  print('motor_testbench node started')
358  original_sigint = signal.getsignal(signal.SIGINT)
359  signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, exit_gracefully)
360  # Initiate the class
361  mtb = motor_testbench()
362  # Set rate
363  rate = rospy.Rate(50) # 10hz
364  # Then start the loop
365  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
366  # mtb.ping_motor()
367  rate.sleep()
